posts.name: William
posts.cooked:
Discord is great for playing games and chilling with friends, or even building a worldwide community. Customize your own space to talk, play, and hang out.

Cross posting this here because need help quickly. My student programmer and I are having trouble with path planner. The path planner works for a single piece autonomous, but when we try to do a multipiece, it will stop after the intake command and not do the path to go back and score.it does anybody have any advice on where to look or troubleshoot this matter? We go to comp week 2 and would love to have a 2 piece auto for that competition.

posts.name: Tom Line
posts.cooked: At first blush, it sounds like that intake command may not be ending.  Is it timed, or is there a .until in the command that insures it ends and you move to the next step?

posts.name: William
posts.cooked: Yes, we use the with time out decorator when declaring the name command and it should only last for about a second

posts.name: ErikSLee
posts.cooked:
You can put the commands and command scheduler on the dashboard to help troubleshoot what is going on with a command.

If you are using the command-based programming features of WPILib, you will find that they are very well integrated with SmartDashboard. It can help diagnose what the robot is doing at any time and...

link_counts.title: Displaying the Status of Commands and Subsystems — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.cooked: The next thing that I have seen that can give this type of behavior is a mismatch between what you type as the command name in path planner and what you type as the named command in the code.  If they are not exactly the same, they will not work.

posts.name: William
posts.cooked: I’ll have to get them to try this

posts.name: William
posts.cooked: I would have thought that too but it actually runs the command and the next part of the auto is actually a pathplanner path follow so to me that tells me that pathplanner is ending the auto at the intake command or the command never ends which it should after the timeout

posts.name: Mike
William
posts.cooked: The method in the subsystem generates the new command so that shouldn’t be a problem

posts.name: Belal Alchahrour
posts.cooked: Just wondering. Were you able to find a fix. We’re experiencing the same issue. Our named commands are all written the same in code and in the gui but it doesn’t seem to run the named command. I also have named commands registered before configuring the auto in the code

posts.name: William
posts.cooked: Yes turns out we had a command that triggers when everything was in a certain position that was causing issues

suggested_topics.excerpt: Try something like this. GenericHID someHid = new GenericHID(1); Trigger btn1 = new Trigger(()->someHid.getRawButtonPressed(1)); btn1.whileTrue(someCommand);
